title: Transmission Engineer II
description:
The Disney Streaming Transmission Engineering group provides a 24-hour operation, with tier 1 and tier 2 support for various broadcast systems. Transmission Engineers operate from the Transmission Operation Center (TOC) or work remotely as required by leadership, managing all A/V transmission paths into our data centers. Engineers also monitor and analyze the delivery of all A/V transmission to our external partners. Candidates should have an eagerness to learn and adapt to new broadcast and IP technologies in order to meet our current and future needs.


This role is a hybrid role based in Amsterdam, that requires 5 consecutive workdays each week, with rotating days off that change weekly.

**What You Will Do**
--------------------


The group is responsible for distribution, switching, and quality control monitoring of event-based and linear acquisition signals, regardless of the format (linear television, IP, fiber, etc.). Transmission Engineers also ensure that assigned partner distribution transmission is configured and routed as ordered. They will act as a technical liaison to clients and our partners to remotely troubleshoot signal issues, as well as notifying internal and external parties of signal outages. Transmission Engineers ensure all signals meet strict quality control standards and adjust video, audio and captions as required. Transmission Engineers are expected to keep meticulous notes on any fixing and will help to compose documentation on standard operating procedures as needed.

**% of Time**
-------------


25% Routing and monitoring multiple A/V feeds to and from our facilities.


25% Quickly identify and resolve issues in a live production environment.


25% Remotely configure hardware as required for live events and linear acquisition and distribution.


25% Provide professional, courteous and timely technical support.

**Required Qualifications & Skills**
------------------------------------

* 2+ years in Broadcast Engineering, Acquisition, Transmission or similar work environment.
* Solid understanding of SD/HD-SDI, ASI, MPEG and J2K signal types.
* Working knowledge of transmission and acquisition equipment and systems.
* Proficiency in analog and digital audio signals.
* Knowledge of networking and TS Over IP principles.
* Experience with Evertz, Snell, Grass Valley, Ross, Ateme, Sencore and other leading manufacturers in routers, switchers and terminal gear.
* Understanding signal flows and CAD drawings.
* Some knowledge of elastic search and real-time analytics/visualizations.
* Experience in similar fast paced environments.


The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. Disney is committed to forming a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Who we are**



At Vandebron, we're transforming the energy landscape, steering away from the conventional to champion sustainability. Born in 2014, our journey began with Chapter 1, disrupting the market with a transparent platform connecting consumers directly to local, green energy producers. Now, in Chapter 2, we are dedicated to ensuring 100% green energy availability, 100% of the time. Think smart solutions — flexible use of wind and solar farms, Smart EV Charging, and efficient energy storage.

  

No waiting around, we actively shape a sustainable future. Good energy, smart solutions — that's Vandebron.

 **This is where you’ll end up**



You will end up in the Data Analytics team, which is at the core of Vandebron. We enable a wide variety of business teams such as digital, finance, marketing, electric mobility as well as customer facing teams, to make data-driven decisions by means of automated reporting, deep dive/ statistical analytics as well as building and maintaining data products.



We also work closely with leadership teams to support business-wide projects and facilitate decision making on a company level. You’ll be working in the commercial analytics team consisting of both data analysts and engineers and led by a Product Owner.



We’re a fast-pacing team that makes high-impact decisions and provides a mix of building and maintaining a state of the art data platform, data modeling and dashboarding as well as solving advanced analytics challenges together with a larger group of business analysts in the domain teams.

 **What are you going to do?**


* Work on improving and operating our (modern) data stack, maintain and improve our current and future ETL (/ELT) pipelines run smoothly and help analysts and engineers improve and extend the existing infrastructure
* Manage our orchestration tooling and make sure our (critical) data products are accessible to internal and external teams
* Working closely within a tight knit central data team that consists of analysts, engineers, data scientists and be the point of contact for embedded analysts
* Work on actively sharing and presenting your findings and knowledge with other business teams, embedded analysts and in the wider data community
* Learn new tools and techniques that continuously improve our existing data infrastructure

 **This is how you make a difference**


* You have a strong background and solid working experience as a data engineer (2+ years)
* You are an strong experience using Python, SQL and have strong knowledge of ETL (ELT) processes and tooling
* You are familiar with modern data tools and preferably have experience with Snowflake/ dbt (or data modeling in general) and orchestration tooling (e.g. Dagster)
* You are engaged and committed to helping stakeholders/ analysts derive value from their data; you’re interested beyond the mere technical details.
* You are someone who actively thinks about business problems, shares findings with stakeholders and is eager to help others find solutions in data. You will help people understand how to get value from data and get the business relevance of an analysis.
* You have experience with visualization tools used for reporting
* You have experience (preferably) with version control and are comfortable with git, working in a centralized environment
* You are a good communicator and are keen to work closely in a close knit team

 **What’s in it for you**


* To work towards our mission with a good dose of energy, we offer you 30 paid days off per year.
* Work abroad for up to 6 weeks per year (max 4 consecutive weeks, including up to 4 weeks outside the EU).
* Employees with three years of service can go on a sabbatical for up to three months (one month paid with holidays, two unpaid).
* Request special leave for significant personal events, volunteering for SDG 11 or 13, and an additional day for religious or personal celebrations (starting on Jan ’25).
* Dive into new skills with an annual €850 learning budget, as well as access to Learning & Development workshops and programs.
* Plan for the future with our solid pension scheme.
* Stay connected hassle-free with a monthly €50 net reimbursement for your phone and wifi.
* One-time €200 net allowance to create a comfortable home workspace for our team members.
* Split your time between our carbon-neutral Amsterdam office at the city’s heart and your home, finding the perfect balance for you.
* Enjoy daily organic lunches prepared by our in-house cooks.
* For those living 10km or more from the office, hop on board with an NS business card for smooth commuting.

  

**Interested?**



Maybe you don’t fit all these requirements but you still think you’re the right person for the role, still apply :).



At Vandebron we believe in diversity, inclusiveness and equal career opportunities. Be your authentic self and it's totally okay with us if you don't mention your gender or date of birth on your resume. We also care about your privacy and handle your data carefully. Under the GDPR, you are not required to provide us with any information about your health, race/nationality, and religion, and you may also omit your social security number (BSN) and passport photo from your job application documentation.

  

If you are as enthusiastic as we are, please apply via this page. Not convinced yet and do you have questions? Feel free to ask them via Jordreukers@vandebron.nl

title: Business Intelligence Intern
description:
**We are Alleo!** The modern employee compensation & reward platform that's rapidly growing. Rapidly indeed: we launched Alleo in August 2021, determined to change the employee benefits landscape. Now, we are a platform for total employee compensation. With our app, we offer employees the benefits that matter. They have access to their personally picked benefits package whenever and wherever they like.  

  

**As a BI intern for Alleo**, you will play a crucial role in supporting our teams by providing accurate and insightful data analysis. You will work closely with customer-facing teams to help them leverage data for better business decisions to ensure data accuracy, maintain reporting systems, and deliver ad hoc data requests.  

  

  



If you want to gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced, innovative environment and to develop your skills in data analysis, visualization, and business intelligence tools, then look no further.  

  



**What you will do**
--------------------


**Dashboard Management & Learning:**


* Assist in managing and updating department-specific dashboards. This includes learning how to add/remove filters and maintain query accuracy amidst data changes.
* Develop a deep understanding of data accuracy and integrity, with guidance on identifying and resolving discrepancies.


**Data Analysis & Reporting:**


* Learn how to respond to ad hoc data requests from different departments, using tools like SQL to extract and analyze data.
* Gain experience in crafting clear and actionable insights through well-structured reports.


**Project-Based Learning:**


* Engage in data-driven projects with the opportunity to take ownership, under the mentorship of a manager.
* Define the scope, objectives, and deliverables of projects, with a focus on aligning with company-wide strategies.
* Develop and implement data-driven solutions, gaining practical experience in problem-solving and strategic thinking.

**What you’ll bring**
---------------------


* Pursuing a degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Basic knowledge of SQL (and Python), with a preference for experience in data visualization tools (e.g., Metabase, Tableau, Power BI).
* Strong analytical skills.
* Ability to communicate complex data findings clearly and concisely.
* A proactive, independent worker with a team-oriented mindset.


**What we offer**
-----------------


* A collaborative and inclusive work environment in a scale-up setting.
* Hands-on experience with cutting-edge HR technology and analytics tools.
* Opportunities for learning and career growth.
* The opportunity to make a real difference in the company’s data strategy and overall success.
* €50 per month benefits budget, which you can spend in the Alleo app.
* Your CO2 is compensated every month.

title: RF Validation Engineer
description:
***Join our cutting-edge start-up adventure!***

**Who are we?**  

Imagine being part of the dynamic journey at Qualinx – a start-up born when three visionary PhD Engineers from TU Delft set out to revolutionize radio chip technology. At Qualinx, we're on a mission to conquer the high-power consumption challenges in Global Navigation Satellite Systems and IoT sensors. With a great team of over 38 individuals, scaling to 50, hosting more than 16 nationalities, we've achieved the impossible - the world's lowest power GNSS chipset. Now, we're on the verge of unleashing our game-changing digital RF technology product, ready to flood the market with millions of annual shipments.  



**What Sets Us Apart**



Joining Qualinx isn't just about a job; it's about embracing high standards, and boldly navigating unexpected challenges. We thrive on collaboration, with a commitment to self-improvement and product excellence. At Qualinx, you're not just an employee; you're an integral part of our exciting journey, contributing to the growth and success of a ground breaking solution.

  


**Job Description**



As an RF Validation Engineer, you will be responsible for creating and carrying out test plans, as well as troubleshooting and analyzing RF measurements using automated test setups. The following will be your core responsibilities:


* Collaborate with the internal design team to define measurement requirements effectively.
* Develop and execute characterization test plans to report the performance of all the parametric data from RF Front End.
* Create Python scripts based on the test plans and perform measurements using automated setups with PXI system and RF instruments.
* Collect and organize data to verify RF performance across different operating conditions, such as temperature, voltage, and process corners.
* Utilize SQL and Jupyter for data management and data visualization.
* Debug and troubleshoot issues that arise during testing, including debugging circuits, analyzing data, and proposing solutions in collaboration with design, application and software teams.
* Document test procedures, results, and specifications for internal reference.
* Develop and configure test equipment (hardware/software/automation) in support of performance characterization.
* Ownership spanning from component-level to full system operation, including SoC bring-up.

 **Requirements**



Qualinx is looking for a result driven and conscientious RF Validation Engineer. Someone who thrives in an environment where your proactive and can-do attitude is highly appreciated. The ideal candidate for this role should have:


* BSc or MSc in Electrical Engineering degree.
* In-depth knowledge and experience with RF circuits include amplifiers, filters, mixers, oscillators and measurement techniques.
* Experienced in PVT characterization and expertise in testing hardware and firmware, including automated test management, integration, and lab failure troubleshooting.
* Experienced in data management and data visualization.
* Experience conducting large-scale automation lab testing across multiple products concurrently.
* Experience in working with Lab equipment, including PXIe, Spectrum analysers, Network analysers, Digitizing Oscilloscopes, Signal generators, DMMs, and programmable power supplies.
* Skilled in programming languages and software tools like MATLAB, Python, and Excel.
* Familiar with microcontroller programming in C language, with knowledge of peripheral interfaces and their integration into embedded systems.
* Proficiency in version control software like GIT.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
* Having knowledge of GNSS and IoT protocols would be considered a bonus point.

  

**What's in it for you?**

* Given that we are a start-up, we provide all our employees with Stock Appreciation Rights. You will be eligible to financially profit from Qualinx's success.
* We support you in your visa process if needed.
* Saving for your pension: we provide an extra 2% of your monthly base salary.
* 25 vacation days based on a 40-hour workweek.
* Work in a beautiful and modern office and lab with all the necessary equipment you need to deliver a great job.
* Every quarter we organize fantastic social events, where we celebrate the success of Qualinx by going out for a great meal, playing VR games, going bowling, etc.
* At Qualinx we invest in the development of our employees, we offer monthly Lunch & Learn sessions to keep everyone who is interested up to speed.

title: Jr. Market Research Analyst (9 months temp role)
description:
**Company Description**  

Avery Dennison Corporation (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science and digital identification solutions company that provides a wide range of branding and information solutions that optimize labor and supply chain efficiency, reduce waste, advance sustainability, circularity and transparency, and better connect brands and consumers. Our products and solutions include labeling and functional materials, radio frequency identification (RFID) inlays and tags, software applications that connect the physical and digital, and a variety of products and solutions that enhance branded packaging and carry or display information that improves the customer experience. Serving an array of industries worldwide — including home and personal care, apparel, general retail, e-commerce, logistics, food and grocery, pharmaceuticals and automotive — we employ approximately 35,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Our reported sales in 2023 were $8.4 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com.

**Avery Dennison is an equal opportunity employer.**  

Please let us know if we can support you with reasonable accommodations throughout the application process by contacting our team via Requestaccomodation@eu.averydennison.com.

 **Job Description**  

As Jr. Market Research Analyst, you will develop an in-depth knowledge of the ecosystem we are currently engaged in. You will act as a valuable resource of the European Marketing team to provide insights related to the Packaging and Label industry as well as the entire value chain. You will have opportunities to participate in projects or assignments where you can interface with different departments and the senior management.


Key Responsibilities

* Deliver monthly and quarterly reports for the management team including market growth and market growth drivers, share performance, macro economic trends, market & competitive insights
* Research and maintain in-depth knowledge of the the Packaging and Label industry ecosystem, including assessment of new technologies and business models
* Analyze and track competitors’ strategy using financial data, annual reports, SWOT analysis, etc.
* Conduct market analysis to assess new business opportunities and Avery Dennison’s positioning
* Conduct market sizing (calculating TAM & SAM) and market forecast analysis
* Translate market insights into relevant findings and recommendations to the commercial teams
* Work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Finance, Procurement, Innovation and IT to provide and consolidate insights
* Deliver presentations and work in project teams where relevant
* Conduct surveys and market research based on business requirements (i.e. VOC, Customer Satisfaction, content for webinars)
* Handle ad-hoc assignments and spot requests/questions
* Fast learner, able to take an initiative, work well under pressure and adapt quickly to changes

 **Qualifications**  

We are looking for candidates who are highly motivated and analytical with the following requirements;

* Bachelor or Master degree in Market Research, Economics, Business Administration, or related
* 1-3 year(s) of experience in Strategic Marketing, Consulting or Market Research / Intelligence, or equivalent
* Strong data analysis, reporting and visualization skills with an eye for details and creativity
* Excellent problem solving skills
* Proficiency in Google Slides & Google Sheets AND/OR Excel
* Knowledge in Qualtrics, Cognos, R (other data analytics tools considered a plus)
* Fluent in writing, speaking and reading in English (other languages considered a plus)
* Excellent organizational and multitasking skills with a positive mindset

 **Additional Information** **We offer:**

* Attractive salary package
* Workplace & work hours flexibility
* Structured learning and development / Mentoring program
* International environment
* Events such as International Women’s Day, Earth Day, etc.
* A growing and welcoming team with good spirit!

**Who we are! - Our Story:**

**Every voice. Every day!** **Eight Values****. One Team!**


Being open to every voice, every day, brings our value of diversity to life and makes Avery Dennison a vibrant and engaging place to be. We understand diversity and equal opportunities as enrichment for our future-oriented work. Across our diverse, global team, every voice makes us stronger. When we listen to and learn from each other, there is no limit to what we can achieve together. Each of us is unique, and we appreciate bringing together different personalities and talents.


Avery Dennison is an equal-opportunity employer. In the **EMEA region**, we have these **Employee Resource Groups**:

* **EmpoWer** - focusing on the engagement, mentoring, and promotion of women
* **Mental Health** - striving to provide a safe space for employees to discuss mental health issues in the workplace
* **Unite** - supporting the LGBTQI+ and ally community in the EMEA region


To find out more about **all our employee resources groups globally** as well as our **Diversity, Equity & Inclusion** approach, please go to our Diversity and Inclusion pages in the About Us section of our website: https://www.averydennison.com/en/home/about-us/diversity-and-inclusion.html


At Avery Dennison, we do what we love, and we love what we do - Just click here, and get to know us better: **Life @ Avery Dennison** (linkedin.com/company/avery-dennison/life/emea)

title: Internal credit risk reporting specialist
description:
Internal credit risk reporting specialist**At a glance**
---------------


The department Finance & Risk Business GRIDs deliver Finance and Risk services to its stakeholders i.e. Group Finance, Risk Management, Legal and Internal Audit. These services encompass operations and change activities for the departments Accounting and Reporting in Finance, Credit Risk, Central Risk Management, Financial Restructuring & Recovery, Risk Modelling, I&ORM, SIM and Compliance in Risk Management and Legal, Corporate Office and Internal Audit in the CEO domain. The Risk MI team in the Reporting GRID is responsible for preparing Credit Risk and Integrated Risk Reports used for internal steering purposes.

**Your job**
------------


As member of the Risk Management Information (MI) domain you will work together with your colleagues on the implementation of credit risk reports and dashboards serving the entire organization with the purpose of becoming the ‘one-stop-shop’ for (credit) risk reports. We aim to provide compass for supporting credit risk steering. The activity of the team is to cover and support the entire report implementation process, starting with collecting requirements from our Business Customers, coordinating and supporting the process between the Reporting Team and Finance & Risk Data Department to obtain fit-for-purpose data for consumption, dashboard development in Power BI, support BCBS 239 compliance (KRI/CDE identification, data requirements setting, data lineage, validation, compliance, etc.) and regular production and maintenance of the dashboards prduced.

**Working environment**
-----------------------


You will operate within the Finance and Risk Reporting GRID. This is a cluster of Agile teams called Value Delivery Blocks. You will become responsible for report implementation within the Risk MI domain.  

The GRID consists of approx. 150 colleagues, who all share the passion for continuously improving the vast set of reports created by the bank. You will have plenty of opportunity to work with colleagues outside the Reporting GRID. We are highly dependent on other GRIDs to jointly create a streamlined supply chain of correct and complete data. We help you develop yourself both professionally and as a person. You will work in a diverse, dynamic and international team that works according to the scaled agile method and is organized in accordance with DevOps way of working. The atmosphere is dynamic, open and informal. We work hard, but there is plenty of room for enjoyment!

**Your profile**
----------------


Our ideal candidate is a team player who combines good work ethics and result-oriented approach with curiosity and adaptiveness, is willing to challenge the status quo and eager to take action to change it. And because we spend quite some time together as a team, a good sense of humour is appreciated. Do you have affinity with credit risk combined with reporting and data? Let’s meet!

* A Master’s degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or other quantitative related field
* 2-5 years of relevant working experience, knowledge of credit & financial products, metrics and indicators; understanding of the associated finance and risk processes, preferably within banking sector
* Proven track record in reporting (regulatory or internal, with focus on Credit Risk); experience with Control Frameworks and BCBS 239 principles applied for related processes is an advantage
* Command of Power BI or similar modern BI tools (PL-300 certification is a plus)
* Basic understanding of the back-end & front-end development processes associated with the internal data sourcing, ETL, modelling, visualization
* Experience with Azure Databricks, SQL/SAS, Python and/or R is a plus
* Experience with participating projects involving multiple stakeholders and/or delivery teams (e.g. business, data, development, monitoring, etc.)
* Ability to perform assignments both individually and in a team in a multicultural environment
* Adaptive, curious, and willing to challenge the status-quo in a healthy and constructive manner
* Excellent analytical skills & problem-solving ability of a proactive nature, strong attitude to identify better solutions and implement them efficiently
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills & proficiency in English, both oral and written
**We are offering**
-------------------

* To be part of a team delivering value and innovation in credit risk reporting
* The opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally
* The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness
* A good salary
* A supplementary benefit budget of 11%, which you can spend on additional fringe benefits
* A personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year
* An annual public transportation pass
* A solid pension plan
**Interested?**
---------------


Are you interested? Respond to this vacancy. For more information, please contact Izabella Nagy via izabella.nagy@nl.abnamro.com. We are looking forward to getting to know you!

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

### **Wij vragen**

* Goede communicatie vaardigheden

### **Wij bieden**

* Analytische skills
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Us


At IT Solutions Worldwide, we pride ourselves on being a trusted partner for businesses seeking strategic guidance and innovative solutions. With a wealth of experience across various industries, our team of seasoned consultants brings unparalleled expertise and a client-centric approach to every project. We are dedicated to delivering tailored strategies that drive operational excellence and sustainable growth. By joining our team, you will become part of a dynamic organization that values professional development, fosters a collaborative environment, and is committed to making a meaningful impact on our clients' success.


Responsibilities

* Analyze customers’ needs and business processes in order to translate them to usable analyses and dashboards.
* Identifying data sources.
* Collecting data.
* Sourcing missing data.
* Organizing data into usable formats.
* Analyzing data to find answers to specific questions.
* Setting up data infrastructure.
* Developing, implementing, and maintaining databases.
* Assessing quality of data and removing or cleaning data.
* Generating information and insights from data sets and identifying trends and patterns.
* Preparing reports for executive and project teams.
* Creating visualizations of data i.e. dashboards etc.


Requirements

* A bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or similar.
* Minimum of 3 years’ experience as a data analyst.
* Should be able to interact with customer teams and internal stakeholders.
* Ability to learn fast and execute accordingly.
* Excellent planning skills.
* Strong mathematical & numeracy skills.
* Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.
* Intermediate understanding of databases such as SQL Server, Oracle, and SAP.
* Understanding of reporting & data visualization tools such as Business Objects, PowerBI, and Tableau.
* Understanding of website scripts such as XML, JavaScript, JSON.
* Knowledge of digital marketing analytics tools including Google 360, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and Adobe Marketing Suite is a nice-to-have.
* Excellent analytical skills - the ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights from data.
* Strong attention to detail.
* Presentation skills – ability to write and speak clearly to easily communicate complex ideas in a way that is easy to understand.


Benefits

* Competitive salary package
* A lot of learning opportunities to enhance your skills and career growth
* Opportunity to relocate to the Netherlands in the future if needed
* Dynamic and collaborative work environment
* Opportunity to work with an innovative and dedicated team
* Travelling costs are reimbursed


Job Types

* Full-time, Contract, Freelance

title: Data Analyst
description:
**ABOUT STICHTING WHITE HELMETS FOUNDATION**

Stichting White Helmets Foundation (SWHF) is a not-for-profit organisation based in the Netherlands. The Foundation aims to provide aid to communities and persons recovering from conflicts and disasters; provide support and orientation to refugees and communities in hosting countries; support justice, human rights efforts, international advocacy and research activities.

Stichting White Helmets Foundation is an equal opportunities employer and applications are actively encouraged from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

**SCOPE OF WORK**

The role of the Data Analyst (DA) is to support the work of the White Helmets Investigation Support and Case-building Unit. Under the direct supervision of the Lead Investigator, DAs are responsible for gathering, triangulating and verifying closed and open-source information. The work of the DAs will primarily be used to support case building tasks within justice and accountability processes related to Syria. Due to the nature of the project, DAs will be required to work with potentially graphic content on a regular basis.

**TERMS OF REFERENCE**

* **Duty station:** The Hague, Netherlands
* **Line manager:** Lead Investigator
* **Line management Responsibility:** N/A
* **Full-time/Part-time:** Full-time

**Tasks and activities**:

* Conduct analysis on closed-source information from the White Helmets archive, identifying opportunities to collect further information to advance investigations into core crimes in Syria.
* Use open-source information to verify images and videos, and geolocate and chronolocate incidents of interest to White Helmet investigations.
* Identify and explore new data sources, combining them with existing data sources to provide OSINT powered analytical insights.
* Perform data entry and data cleaning tasks for pertinent databases, which compile and integrate evidence for each case based on incidents, alleged perpetrators, victims, locations, groups, and other pertinent factors related to the investigation.
* Present factual findings and draft analytical reports and assessments.
* Coordinate and collaborate with team members to address and resolve complex issues encountered during information review, analysis and investigation. Contribute to the establishment of the WH investigation database.
* Implement effective mechanisms for systematic information collection and maintain database of sources relevant for the Syria situation.
* Any other support task required to assist investigators, including production of summaries and collations, corroboration checks, and sourcing of reports or other analytical products.

**Required qualifications: Education, Experience and Competencies:**

* Bachelor’s degree in data science, computer science, criminology, law or other relevant field is an advantage but not a requirement.
* Two years of professional experience in open-source research and investigation.
* Demonstrated knowledge of photo and video verification techniques and geolocation methods; Knowledge of using Geographic Information Systems is preferred.
* Strong knowledge of various interactive visualization tools.
* Proven understanding of social media platforms, trends, and monitoring.
* Ability to handle complex/large amounts of information and derive actionable insights from data.
* Strong reasoning skills, including ability to understand complex scenarios of crime, to simultaneously handle conflicting information and hypotheses, to identify source biases, and to develop sound logical inferences.
* Ability to perform work with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.
* Cross-cultural communication and interpersonal skills, and ability to interact professionally with culturally diverse staff and stakeholders.
* Clear understanding operational and personal security factors including high levels of cyber hygiene.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills in English is required.
* Oral and written communication skills in Arabic are a significant asset.
* Strong understanding of the Syrian context is an advantage.
* High standards of confidentiality, reliability and discretion.
* Integrity by sharing the SWHF’s values and ethical standards.
* we will also consider candidates who have not been able to complete their studies but have a level of education that allows for clear communication, assessment, and organization of information supported by practical experience in open-source investigation.

**How to Apply:**

**The position is open to candidates with valid work and residence permits in the Netherlands and/or EU.** 

If you are interested in applying for this position, please fill out the application form and attach your CV and a covering letter in English explaining your background, suitability for the role and interest in what we do.

Closing deadline for application: **15 September 2024.** Only shortlisted applicants who meet the required job qualifications will be contacted.

**We will be reviewing applications as they come in. Immediate availability is a plus. The closing date for this post may be brought forward or extended depending on the volume and strength of applications**.

Only shortlisted applicants who meet the required job qualifications will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: In person

Expected Start Date: 01/10/2024

title: BI Analyst / Product Owner Business Intelligence (f/m/x)
description:
The Nippon Express Group is one of the leading global logistics service providers whose Japanese corporation is headquartered in Tokyo. Our services range from air and ocean freight forwarding to cargo, removal services and warehouse operations. The company has numerous freight centers, warehouses and provides logistics services in over 45 countries on six continents with a global network of over 70,000 employees. The logistics focus is mainly on automotive and fashion industries, pharmaceutical products and further consumer goods. Within the past years Nippon Express has been on a continuous growth path within the EMEA region and we are looking for new talents to join our mission.


We seek a skilled Business Analyst with BI Tooling (Tableau) expertise to join our team. You will be responsible for meeting various stakeholders' data and enabling analytics needs by developing comprehensive dashboards, reports, and visualizations on the (Tableau cloud) platform.


**This role requires a strong understanding of data analysis, and excellent communication skills to support data-driven decisions. This is an excellent opportunity to enhance your skills and contribute to our digitalization journey.**

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Stakeholder Management:** Build strong relationships and effectively manage competing priorities across business units.
* **Dashboard Development:** **”):** Utilize Tableau (Cloud) or similar BI tools to create and manage complex data visualizations and dashboards.
* **Data Analysis:** Gather and analyze data to provide actionable insights that support business objectives.
* **Communication:** Provide comprehensive training and support to the European Business Development division and its business users to enhance data-driven decision-making, ensuring all division requirements are met.
* **Reporting:** Develop reports and dashboards, ensuring they meet the highest standards of accuracy and reliability.
* **Cross-functional Collaboration:** Work seamlessly with diverse teams across functions and geographical locations.
* **Requirements Gathering:** Identify, analyze, and translate complex business requirements into actionable Tableau Cloud dashboards, reports, and visualizations.
* **Tableau Advocacy:** Promote the use of Tableau Cloud and foster a data-driven culture within the organization.

**Requirements**

* You should have a minimum of 2-4 years of initial work experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst/ Project Manager/ Developer for BI Tool Implementation or in a similar role.
* A good understanding of data analytics and business intelligence concepts with a focus on business performance analysis is required.
* You must have experience in creating dashboards and visualizations using Tableau, Power BI, or other BI tools.
* The role is partially a product owner role which requires excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to train non-technical audiences (e.g., Sales Representatives) to expand the adoption of BI/ Tableau dashboards.
* Furthermore, you are efficient in gathering requirements, analyzing data, and delivering actionable insights.
* Capable to work effectively in a matrix organization.
* Self-motivated and proactive, with excellent organizational skills and capable of working autonomously or collaboratively in a team setting.
* Fluency in English is required, other languages are a plus.

**Benefits**

* A permanent position within a leading logistics company
* Motivating tasks within a diverse and international environment
* Great team members who will help you to get onboarded quickly
* Excellent Work-Life-Balance, possibility to Work From Home (hybrid model)
* Various additional benefits

ABOUT THE ROLE

ABOUT US
Kraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. Our emerging and iconic food and beverage brands deliver the best taste, fun, and quality to every table we touch. Worldwide.


We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. Consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress. As we drive innovation company-wide.


Our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We believe in being good humans — working to improve our company, communities, and planet.


We’re proud of where we’ve been and even more thrilled about where we’re headed as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.


WHY US
We grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our iconic and nostalgic brands.


Good isn’t good enough. We choose greatness every day by making bold decisions and challenging what’s ordinary. All while celebrating our wins – and failures – as we work together to transform the future of food.


GROW YOUR FULL  

POTENTIAL
Be ambitious. Aim high. Lead like the owner of our business. Realize your passions and purpose, here at Kraft Heinz.

title: Senior Strategic Sourcing Specialist
description:
At Medtronic you can begin a life-long career of exploration and innovation, while helping champion healthcare access and equity for all. You’ll lead with purpose, breaking down barriers to innovation in a more connected, compassionate world.
A Day in the Life
JD under development
We are looking for a Senior Strategic Sourcing Professional to join the Global Category Management team supporting Global Supply Chain for the market leader in medical device technology. This person will support Global Supply Chain Related Category Management. This person will work in strong partnership with the Global Category Directors for Transportation and Warehousing/Fulfillment, and with Medtronic’s Global and Regional Supply Chain Deliver teams. In this multi-faceted role, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on the storage and delivery of life-changing technology and contribute directly to our company mission to alleviate pain, restore health and extend life.
We are looking for a Senior Strategic Sourcing Specialist Professional to join the Global Category Management team supporting Global Supply Chain for the market leader in medical device technology. This person will support Global Supply Chain Related Category Management and be assigned a Global (sub) Category for Transportation, Warehousing and Fulfilment. This person will work in strong partnership with the Global Category Directors for Transportation and Warehousing/Fulfillment, and with Medtronic’s Global and Regional Supply Chain Deliver teams. In this multi-faceted role, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on the storage and delivery of life-changing technology and contribute directly to our company mission to alleviate pain, restore health and extend life.
Required Knowledge and Experience:* Bachelor’s Degree and at least 3 years of strategic sourcing experience in both Strategic Sourcing (Category Management) and Supply Chain (Transportation, Distribution including 3PL, and Trade Compliance) in a large, multi-divisional corporation
* Experience in sourcing and driving/executing category strategies
* Experience in forming and maintaining strategic partnerships
* English language skills (verbal & written)
* Strong analytical skills including Excel (pivots, lookups, basic formulas, etc.) and data visualization tools like Power BI
* Strong negotiation skills
* Proven proficiency in: Project Management, and the systems and tools used throughout Operations and Supply Management (e.g. Ariba, SAP, BU specific tools/systems etc.)
* Awareness of technical aspects of procurement (such as use of data, special requirement development, cost comparison, should cost analysis, root cause/corrective action)
* Track record in achieving cost savings and contract implementation and management
* Knowledge of the Procure-to-Pay process
* Previous roles in Global or Regional Transportation and Logistics Supply Chain
* Experience implementing or supporting a TMS (Transportation Management System)
* Experience with imperfect data and data quality enhancements
* Previous experience in operational optimization or supply chain project management


Physical Job Requirements  

  

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position.
Benefits & Compensation
Medtronic offers a competitive Salary and flexible Benefits Package  

A commitment to our employees lives at the core of our values. We recognize their contributions. They share in the success they help to create. We offer a wide range of benefits, resources, and competitive compensation plans designed to support you at every career and life stage.  

About Medtronic
We lead global healthcare technology and boldly attack the most challenging health problems facing humanity by searching out and finding solutions.  

Our Mission — to alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life — unites a global team of 90,000+ passionate people.  

We are engineers at heart— putting ambitious ideas to work to generate real solutions for real people. From the R&D lab, to the factory floor, to the conference room, every one of us experiments, creates, builds, improves and solves. We have the talent, diverse perspectives, and guts to engineer the extraordinary.
Learn more about our business, mission, and our commitment to diversity here

title: BI Engineer
description:
Join our client’s engineering team to work on cutting-edge Business Intelligence (BI) and Data Visualization solutions. You’ll collaborate with a diverse group of professionals, supported by a Solution Architect and Agile Coach, to drive feature development and optimize technical strategies.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Work with platforms like Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx, and IBM Cognos Analytics.
* Maintain, troubleshoot, and upgrade BI platforms, ensuring security and performance.

**Your ideal profile:**

You’ll report to engineering leadership, who will guide your career growth.


**About Levy:**



Since 2000 Levy provides professional Solutions to organizations ranging from tech start-ups to global players. From our offices in the UK and Amsterdam we have built an international local network of skilled employed professionals and contractors fueled by our passion for connecting skills with projects. Over the years we have fulfilled over 1700 requirements and nowadays we consistently have 250+ professionals recruited and relocated from 14 countries allocated to various projects. title: Senior Analyst
description:
**Job Description** **Senior Analyst**


NielsenIQ · Retail Analytics for Jumbo supermarkets -Amstelveen, Netherlands

**About the job**


Senior Analyst will work in Retail Analytics Team to support the implementation of client solutions and deliver analytical projects to build customer-centric strategies for NIQ’s Client (Jumbo supermarket) based in the Netherlands.


The person will be accessing, analyzing and interpreting customer and transactional data to facilitate the implementation of NIQ’s CRM Marketing, Insights and solutions in collaboration with Jumbo.

**Responsibilities**

* Work cross-functionally to deliver and present actionable customer insights to senior stakeholders at Jumbo (the 2nd largest retailer in the Netherlands) with ability to convey complex analytical subjects to less-analytical audiences
* Deliver projects and reports analyzing the shopping behavior of over 3 mil Loyalty program members to drive customer strategy
* Collaborate with Central (R&D) teams to configure and implement advanced models that deliver over 1 billion personal offers each year to Jumbo’s customers
* Lead projects that forecast, measure and quantify the results of marketing campaigns and programs
* Own the delivery of multiple and concurrent analytical projects
* Find efficiencies by identifying faster and simpler ways to deliver ongoing customer reports
* Always look out and experiment with different techniques/methods to improve existing solutions
* Managing initiatives with a ‘get things done’ mentality and strong sense of ownership.
* Ability to work under stress, sometimes due to tight deadlines.
* Strong presentation skills including the ability to convey often complex analytical subjects to less-analytical audiences.

**About Retail Analytics team**


The unit specializes in delivering bespoke analytical projects to improve Jumbo’s Customer program and Supplier interaction programs. By applying a ‘can do’ attitude, translate NielsenIQ’s solutions and recommendations into tangible benefits for our client and support their strategies.

**Requirements**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, Economics, Econometrics, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science or similar.
* 2+ years of directly related work experience in Retailer / Marketing / CRM analytics.
* Proficiency in working with statistical and econometric models in marketing to support clients in preferably Retail and CPG areas.
* Background from working in other data-rich B2C industries can be considered
* Proficiency in using SQL.
* Python knowledge is advantage
* A consultant mindset in problem diagnosis and actionable solution proposes based on data and data analysis.
* Ability to communicate insights from data using narratives and visualizations.
* Good team spirit.
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint.

**What we can offer**

* Direct impact to the client business with his/her recommendations and deliveries
* Possibility to learn CRM and Jumbo’s edge cutting personalized loyalty program
* Work with in the international environment

  

**Additional Information** **Our Benefits**

* Flexible working environment
* Volunteer time off
* LinkedIn Learning
* Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


**About NIQ**


NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.


For more information, visit NIQ.com


Want to keep up with our latest updates?


Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook


**Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**


NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. title: Office Support Specialist (15 hours/week)
description:
### **Smartvatten**

Smartvatten is a dynamic workplace that values strategy, leadership, and collaboration. We help real estate and water utility companies optimize water consumption through monitoring, analysis, leak detection, and data visualization for a sustainable future.


Are you interested in being part of a purposeful job? Say no more; we seek a proactive, attentive part-timer (15 hours/week). The ideal candidate will handle office equipment, manage deliveries, and maintain a well-organized and efficient workspace.


The **Office Support Specialist's** all-around position and day-to-day tasks are focused on ensuring smooth daily operations by managing various office-related tasks, emphasizing supporting and assisting duties.


**What You'll Do:**
-------------------


 

* Maintain a current inventory of office any equipment, assess the need for additional equipment, and ensure all devices are functional and available as required
* Sprinkle everyday magic into our workdays, fostering a fun, happy, and productive workplace environment. For example, one potential future project is refurnishing the office while considering cost-effectiveness
* Keep the office clean and organized, take care of communal areas and office plants
* Manage incoming and outgoing mail and packages, ensuring excellent internal distribution of mail and deliveries
* Execute engaging internal events, from creative contests to structured gatherings like local team-building activities, customer lunches, conferences, occasional celebrations, and attending business center community meetings
* Be the go-to person for employee needs and the first point of contact for facility, office, and occupational safety ombudsperson for safety checks and first aid compliance
* Foster a fantastic workplace experience by supporting employees on site (e.g., access keys, parking, bookings), embracing our hybrid work approach, and ensuring our office is a hub of positivity and productivity

**Is it you?**
--------------

* ️ High school diploma or equivalent; additional qualifications in office administration or related fields are a plus
* Previous experience in an office management role or other service-focused roles
* Bilingual Dutch level and fluent English
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
* ️ Proactively can tackle unforeseen challenges and tasks, utilizing problem-solving skills to ensure a smooth and efficient office environment
* Has excellent organizational and multitasking abilities
* Possesses strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Bring innovative ideas to enhance our workplace
* Will thrive from working 1 to 2 days on-site, contributing to a vibrant and collaborative office culture

**Why****Smartvatten?**
-----------------------


Take a look at More information about our solution & take a look at our career site We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all team members, regardless of gender identity, sexual orientation, or disabilities, are guaranteed equal pay for equal work at every stage of their careers.


* Be an integral part of a global scaling journey
* Comprehensive starter kit including your preferred working tools such as PC or MacBook Air, Phone + phone Subscription Plan
* The opportunity to impact a more sustainable future
* Work-life balance and Flexibility
* You will be part of a company culture that promotes collaboration, compassion, and a positive work environment
* The workplace is located in a convenient area (Science Park 301, Amsterdam)
* Able to network with other companies as we are part of a business center

**Apply Easily by**
-------------------

* Submitting your application using your LinkedIn profile or an English CV. (Application period: 19.08. - 01.09.2024) We are constantly taking a look at the applications. Do not miss the chance by applying later


* Chat: Engage in a 45-minute conversation with Claudia Cervantes, Talent Acquisition, to get an overview of the position and the company


* Big 5 (OCEAN) 10 min assessment for making customized interview questions and makinginformed hiring decisions
* Potentially meet your future closest colleague: Engage in a 45-minute discussion with Nick Hirschstein, Global Partner Manager


* Offer chat with Claudia and Greta Turkama, Head of People and Culture. Discuss the position benefits, perks, and the zero-hour employment contract and when you could start


* Welcome to the Smartvatten team, and start making a positive impact!
  

We will provide working tools and set up necessary accounts during the pre-onboarding. During the onboarding, we expect you to be a fast learner and organized enough to perform the day-to-day work. During the onboarding, it is crucial to start office-based for 1-3 days, then later based on working tasks hybrid.

title: Business Intelligence Reporting Specialist
description:
Enza Zaden is currently on a mission to be the most data savvy and data driven breeding company in the world and therefore we are looking for you, a BI Reporting Specialist in the Data, Analytics and Reporting Team for our Seed Operations department. We are seeking a Senior Business Intelligence Reporting Specialist to join our team and help shape the future of our data reporting and analytics.
As a Senior Business Intelligence Reporting Specialist, you will be instrumental in driving data savviness and enabling data-driven insights that align with and support the execution of Enza Zaden's strategy. You will be responsible for developing, managing, and optimizing our BI reporting solutions, ensuring data accuracy, and providing key stakeholders with the information they need to make informed decisions. You will translate the needs of colleagues within your assigned function into actionable reports and dashboards, educating and empowering them to leverage data for smarter decision-making. This role requires a strategic thinker with a strong analytical background, exceptional technical skills, and a passion for data visualization and reporting.
Responsibilities* Design and deliver comprehensive reporting and analysis solutions for the assigned function.
* Define data requirements, scope, and planning for various requests.
* Advise management on strategies to achieve data and reporting goals.
* Lead insights development, connecting diverse data sources to drive effective decision-making at both operational and management levels.
* Facilitate discussions to prioritize data and reporting needs, aligning them with the strategic objectives of both your function and Enza Zaden. Develop and execute training plans for users within the function.
* Ensure comprehensive documentation of reporting setups, standards, assumptions, and user manuals to enhance cross-functional collaboration.
* Implement necessary authorizations, security standards, and, where applicable, report certification to secure and democratize data across the organization.


Requirements* Relevant BI certificates, University-level education (Master’s degree preferred), ideally in an analytics-related field.
* Proficient with BI tooling (eg PowerBI), SQL, ERP systems, Databricks, DBT, Excel, data visualisation tooling, statistics
* Analytical skills. Strong analytical abilities with a knack for structuring and prioritizing complex information.
* Communication and training skills. Excellent communication and training skills, with the ability to educate and empower colleagues.
* Ability to structure and prioritise complex and diffuse information


Engage proactively with teams and knowledge platforms to identify and address knowledge gaps, continuously improving Enza Zaden's data capabilities. Working together with:* Data, Analytics & Reporting teams - Proactively collaborate in realizing the annual action plan and longer term strategy.
* Colleagues within the assigned function - Train, educate, and stimulate the use of BI tooling, collect feedback and ensure report/dashboard improvements.
* Data Architecture and Modelling Specialists, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Platform Engineers, Smart Data Platform Product Owner, Manager Datalab - Align on data modelling and data standards, Ensure data quality.
* Peers in other functions - Collaborate on creating cross functional reports, share best practices, ensure use of right data sources.
* Cross functional knowledge and experience platforms - Share best practices, ensure standardization of views and layouts.


Our Power
At Enza Zaden, we want to make a difference, because tomorrow needs a difference. The purpose of our work? To offer everyone worldwide access to healthy and varied vegetables. Curious to learn more about our journey? Please enjoy the new Enza Zaden brand movie: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7yxla\_xDJ-I
Enza Zaden is a vegetable breeding company that develops vegetable varieties. And produces and sells its seeds all over the world. From the ambition of one man, we grew into a global family company with a shared passion for plants. That great passion is reflected in the vegetable varieties we develop and the seeds we produce.
All we do is driven by a clear and ambitious goal: to grant people anywhere in the world access to healthy, varied vegetables. How do we do it? By working shoulder-to-shoulder with our business partners. It is vital to understand their challenges, wishes, and needs. It keeps us sharp and inspired and enables us to develop exactly the right products for the right markets at the right time. We keep our minds open and our creativity flowing. Innovation is at the core of our business.
Would you like to know more about Enza Zaden as an employer? Then take a look at the Careers & Learning page or view our page on LinkedIn.
Contact
Nick van Dijk
Corporate Recruiter
+31 6 1544 5587
n.vandijk@enzazaden.nl
  
Über uns


Unsere Mitarbeiter sind die treibende Kraft unseres Unternehmens. Jeder Einzelne trägt aus seinem spezifischen Fachgebiet heraus dazu bei, die Gemüsesorten der Zukunft zu schaffen.
Wir setzen auf Spezialisten und die breit gefächerten Kompetenzen von Menschen mit langjähriger Erfahrung in diesem Bereich. Und die innovative Vision von Praktikanten und Quereinsteigern. Wir schätzen dieses Wissen und diese Erfahrung und investieren daher in unsere Mitarbeiter, indem wir ihnen viele Möglichkeiten zur persönlichen Entwicklung und Weiterentwicklung bieten.
Wirf einen Blick auf unsere aktuellen Stellenangebote und prüfe, ob es eine Möglichkeit gibt, die zu dir passt.

title: Global Specification Manager - Micro ingredients
description:
About the job

Global Specification Manager to manage the specifications for micro ingredients in Europe, which could include flavours, colours, minerals, vitamins, amino acids, and premixes as per business/project needs.



Creating specifications to meet the needs of finished product, consumer & market, as well as managing the Specifications approval process & maintaining up to date (SAP System) data will be a part of the role.



Required to connect with multiple functions within Danone Specialized Nutrition and with suppliers to align on details of specifications to ensure full food safety and regulatory compliance to ensure highest standards of finished products for sensitive customers.


About you
* A Bachelors or Master’s degree in food science/technology, quality/safety/regulatory or related field


* Minimum 2 years’ experience in an ingredient, regulatory or quality related area in the food industry, preferably with ingredient specification management experience.


* Knowledge and experience working with micro ingredients i.e. flavours, colours, minerals, vitamins, amino acids and premixes would be a definite plus, as well as knowledge of global regulations, although not essential.


* Excellent team working & communication skills in cross functional and highly international environment


* Ability to work structurally and focused with good time management skills


* Ability to work pragmatically and agile in a changing and complex environment


* Resilience and determination to make things happen


* Good data analysis skills to be translated in data maintenance improvements and data visualization through dashboards is a plus


* Experience in SAP systems is a plus


* Good skills in MS Office, esp. Excel.


About us

Working here you’ll need to enjoy a fast-pace, complexity and it can get a little challenging. But it’s packed with opportunities. You’ll work with some of the best-known brands in the world, such as Evian, Nutricia, Activia and Nutrilon and we absolutely guarantee that you can just be yourself. Be innovative and entrepreneurial and the impact you could make might just amaze you. Join our movement for a healthier world. **One Planet One Health BY YOU**.



We are proud to be an equal employer. We are convinced our differences make the difference and that an inclusive working environment will drive our growth as a business, as teams and as individuals. We will therefore consider **all** applicants for employment\* fostering an inclusive working culture that is accessible for all.



Did you know that as a B-Corp certified company, Danone Benelux meets the highest verified standards of social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability?

  


**We Offer**



At Danone, we offer a complete package of benefits, with a competitive primary salary and yearly bonus, but also benefits like a premium free pension, 30 days annual leave and several discounts on a collective health insurance and even on some of our products.

  


**What’s next?**



Hit the “apply now” button now. To comply with GDPR regulations, we cannot process your personal data without given consent. Therefore, we strongly recommend applying directly via our career website.

  



Need more information? Please contact Joost Rijksen, Talent Manager Quality and Research & Innovation via joost.rijksen@danone.com.

  


* all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status

title: Assistant Professor In Geometric Learning and Image Analysis
description:
**Job description**
-------------------


In the Geometric Learning and Differential Geometry Group (GLDG) within the Centre for Analysis, Scientific Computing and Applications (CASA) we invent, apply, and build new theory and methods in geometric AI for automated medical and industrial image analysis. The Geometric Deep learning methods developed in GLDG bridge the gap in image processing between machine learning and traditional PDE/geometry-based methods.


The focus in the group GLDG supported by VICI project “Geometric Learning for Image Analysis” (R. Duits) is on PDE-based equivariant neural networks aiming for impact on industry and society. This requires close interplay between mathematical theory and practical requirements. With implementation running parallel to theoretical development, we ensure that our geometric learning is both well-founded in profound new mathematics and relevant for practical applications.


Key objectives of the position are:


* Develop high-performance implementations of geometric learning methods for modern hardware whileconnecting advanced scientific computing to applied and geometric analysis.
* Establish connections to industryvia joint projects ongeometric learning and image processing**,** while investing in in-house implementations to keep our research relevant for industry.
* Target and steer the direction of the theory by available hardware and performance. Advanced geometrical, topological theory and algorithms need to be developed.
* Be active in funding acquisition and set up a clear, personal, and visible research line that fits the overall activities and strategy in the GLDG group and CASA cluster.
* Open the black box of deep learning via geometric interpretability and explainable AI. Promising results are growing and allow for clear analysis by experts, but intuitive visualization and interpretation tools to industrial/health tech partners raise challenges to be tackled.
* Design new equivariant PDE-based neural networks**.** Current methods in GLDG reveal drastic network reduction, and training data-reduction with better performances. Pursue a research direction in explainable and transferable geometric AI. Analysis of topological transitions, semi-ring co-domain extensions, Lie group domain extensions require new models.
* Connect to the GLDG group, the CASA cluster, and the M&CS department at TU/e, and act in cross-divisional institutes such as EAISI**,** to guarantee a vibrant, well-embedded and well-funded research group with better network design and image analysis applications.

**Job requirements**
--------------------

* Motivated researcher, with a PhD in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Electrical Engineering or Computational Physics, or a related field, with both an applied computational and a geometric interest.
* Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art computational methods in both geometric learning, differential geometry and geometric image processing.
* Excellent programming and software engineering skills both for developing CPU code (Python/Mathematica, C++), GPU (CUDA/Triton) code and other modern parallel hardware.
* Ability to conduct high quality academic research, reflected in demonstratable outputs.
* Ability to teach, demonstrated by experience or assistance in teaching. Informed vision on teaching and learning within your own discipline. Motivated to teach, contribute to teaching processes, and to develop excellent teaching skills.
* Strong cooperation skills and ability to work in an interdisciplinary team.
* Effective communication and leadership skills, including coaching and mentoring of students and staff, leading a project or chairing a group.
* Excellent (written and verbal) proficiency in English.

**Conditions of employment**
----------------------------


A meaningful job in a dynamic and ambitious university, in an interdisciplinary setting and within an international network. You will work on a beautiful, green campus within walking distance of the central train station. In addition, we offer you:


* An 18-month contract as Assistant Professor which can become permanent after 12 months on the same employment level upon successful evaluation.
* The opportunity to focus your career on education, research or impact. You can develop your personal ambitions and objections within the strategic objectives of the university.
* Salary in accordance with the *Collective Labour Agreement* for Dutch Universities, scale 11 (min. €4492, max. €6148 gross per month).
* A year-end bonus of 8.3% and annual vacation pay of 8%.
* A dedicated mentoring program to help you get to know the university and the Dutch (research) environment.
* High-quality training programs for academic leadership and teaching.
* An excellent technical infrastructure, on-campus children's day care and sports facilities.
* Partially paid parental leave and an allowance for commuting, working from home and internet costs.
* A Staff Immigration Team is available for international candidates, as are a tax compensation scheme (the 30% facility) and partner career support.

**Information and application**
-------------------------------

**About us**

Eindhoven University of Technology is an internationally top-ranking university in the Netherlands that combines scientific curiosity with a hands-on attitude. Our spirit of collaboration translates into an open culture and a top-five position in collaborating with advanced industries. Fundamental knowledge enables us to design solutions for the highly complex problems of today and tomorrow.  

  

Curious to hear more about what it's like as a professor at TU/e? Please view the video.


**Information**

Do you recognize yourself in this profile and would you like to know more?  

Please contact the hiring manager dr.ir. Remco Duits, Associate Professor and Head of the Geometric Learning and Differential Geometry Group, R.Duits@tue.nl, or +31 624983108.  

  

Visit our website for more information about the application process or the conditions of employment. You can also contact Hella Ploegmakers, Senior Recruiter, h.a.m.ploegmakers@tue.nl or +31 643559625.  

  

Are you inspired and would like to know more about working at TU/e? Please visit our career page.


**Application**


We invite you to submit a complete application.  

The application should include a:


* Cover letter in which you describe your motivation and qualifications for the position.
* Curriculum vitae, including a list of your publications and the contact information of three references.
* Description of your scientific interests and plans (1-2 pages).
* Statement of your teaching goals and experience (1-2 pages).


We look forward to receiving your application and will screen it as soon as possible. The vacancy will remain open until the position is filled.

title: Data Analyst I
description:
Role Description:

As a Data Analyst (DA) for Talent you will perform both ad hoc analysis, regular reporting that delivers relevant, action-oriented and innovative recommendations to Talent leads and managers which result in tangible Talent Acquisition Improvements. The DA provides analysis, reports and data insights that helps prioritize efforts and enables data-driven decisions, optimizing Talents’ impact through effective storytelling.
The successful DA will initiate, validate, prioritize and work on projects autonomously and command strong stakeholder management skills. **Key Responsibilities**  

* Builds dashboards, analysis and reporting that help stakeholders understand the performance, risks and opportunities.
* Perform analysis to deep-dive business challenges or opportunities, on request and on your own initiative.
* Use creative and innovative thinking to identify different opportunities to further improve Talent processes while using a data driven approach.
* Work with stakeholders to understand their objects and goals and prepare strong insights that provide visibility and turn this into practical KPI’s.
* Deliver regular and ad hoc reports with clear and actionable insights.
* Maintain key reports, metrics and workflows running within their scope by collaborating with teams and peers to communicate results and outcomes clearly to stakeholders.
* Communicate effectively, candidly, collaboratively, and challenge constructively to create rapport and establish trust.
* Ensure high quality output, by taking quality assurance measures.
* Work independently with limited guidance of Analytics Manager / TL or business stakeholder on data collection and preparation.
* Use Talent wide data to take complex scenarios to translate business problems into data stories.
* Deliver easy to understand analysis or reports from clearly specified and prioritized business topics.
* Optimize existing analysis, reportings and data insights to align with the fast paced environment that changes rapidly.
* Actively participate in business and/or analytics team activities (standup, planning meeting, retrospectives).
* Awareness of statistical models used within their scope.
* Familiarity with the larger data ecosystem at Booking and understanding of how it relates to the data.
* Open to adopting new approaches and expanding technical competencies when a more efficient way presents itself.
* Demonstrates accountability overall when delivering actionable reporting.
* Communicates challenges, opportunities and actions to improve data quality and consistency within the team.

Proactively identify automation solutions on the different deliverables to have updated data.  
* 

  

**Stakeholder Management*** Use data and interpersonal skills to manage stakeholders and innovate towards achieving ambitions together and create high performing working relationships.
* Aligns autonomously with the stakeholders what will be delivered and when, prioritizes items on what is being worked on and what can be expected when.

 **Requirements of special knowledge/skills*** Demonstrated track record of performing data analysis and translating into business opportunities to aid stakeholders decision making.
* Strong technical skills who proactively improves processes and automates tasks.
* Able to present findings in an effective, structured and actionable way to a wide set of audiences with varying levels of understanding.
* Able to explain complex problems, analyses and topics in concise, clear and simple terms.
* Advanced knowledge of using SQL and relational databases to query and extract data.
* Highly proficient in using data analysis, reporting and visualization tools: e.g. Tableau, Excel, Google sheets.
* Strong stakeholder management skills to manage expectations on delivery and influencing opinion using data.
* Comfortable working with cross-functional teams and in a flexible environment to aid analysis and external factors that need to be considered in their analysis.
* Able to effectively build a relevant network in the organization and strong relationships with direct stakeholders across all levels of the organization.
* Highly organized that can reprioritize effectively in a fast paced environment.
* Strong verbal presentation skills, highly data driven with exceptionally high attention to detail
